# Roleplay Rule 9 â€“ Do Not Cause Excessive Death, Damage, or Destruction
Prospect Sector has **no antagonist roles**. Therefore, no player ever has permission or justification to cause major destruction, mass death, or wide-scale sabotage.
Players must not: - Destroy large sections of the station - Disable core infrastructure - Cause atmos disasters, fires, explosions, or mass power failures - Round-remove or kill players without valid escalation - Harm the station in ways that halt progression or make areas uninhabitable
Even with roleplay justification, large-scale sabotage is never acceptable. Minor accidents, mistakes, or localized issues are normal and expected; **intentional** destruction is not.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - Small, localized damage caused accidentally while working (engineering mistakes, testing errors). - Causing minor, recoverable issues during legitimate gameplay (an experiment goes wrong). - Defending yourself with proportionate force when escalated to violence.
### Prohibited: - Detonating bombs or explosives in populated areas. - Releasing dangerous anomalies, mobs, singularities, or hazardous atmos. - Destroying power generation, SMES, atmos systems, or critical machinery. - Intentionally spacing areas, depressurizing departments, or creating large fires. - Causing mass death or disabling multiple departments at once. - Using destructive tools to grief the station or halt progression. - Round-removing players without escalation or extreme justification.
## Final Note Prospect Sector is a **cooperative environment**. Intentional large-scale destruction is always considered griefing unless directly authorized by administrators for a special event.
